decks.notes: The main idea of the deck is to quickly ramp up mana and cheat big, powerful creatures into play using the "Show and Tell" card. The deck includes powerful cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand, which can easily win the game if they hit the battlefield early. The deck also includes a variety of card draw and control spells to help find and protect the combo pieces. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with immense threats early in the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the Bomberman combo, which involves using Auriok Salvagers to recur Lion's Eye Diamond for infinite mana. Karn, the Great Creator can shut down opponents' artifacts, while Gyruda, Doom of Depths serves as a companion. The deck includes a variety of mana acceleration cards and ways to tutor for key pieces, such as Ranger of Eos. The key strategy is to generate a large amount of mana quickly to cast powerful spells like Starnheim Unleashed and close out the game.

The main concept of this deck is to achieve early board control and generate card advantage through a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful card draw spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan through interaction with cards like Force of Will and Fatal Push while also presenting a strong threat through creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Baleful Strix. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tireless Tracker to generate value over time, ensuring a steady stream of resources. Overall, the deck focuses on aggression and card advantage to dominate the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and efficiently cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield using cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Simian Spirit Guide. By carefully controlling the game with spells like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Force of Will, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures and win the game in just a few turns. The mana base is designed to support this strategy, with a focus on speed and consistency to execute the combo successfully.

The focus of this Bant Control deck is to control the board through a variety of spells and abilities, including countering opponent's spells with Force of Will and Flusterstorm, removing threats with Swords to Plowshares, and manipulating the top of the deck with Brainstorm and Ponder. This deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Hullbreacher and Narset, Parter of Veils helps to further disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Day's Undoing and Sylvan Library provide additional card draw and selection.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful midrange threats like Leovold, Uro, and Baleful Strix to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a solid ramp package including Arcum's Astrolabe and efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent while generating card advantage. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an extra layer of versatility and allows for additional value through blinking permanents. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands to ensure smooth mana curve progression.

This deck focuses on generating card advantage, controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells, and utilizing powerful planeswalkers to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also seeks to ramp up quickly with mana-fixing artifacts like Arcum's Astrolabe and powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck aims to establish board presence with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dreadhorde Arcanist while keeping the opponent on the back foot with disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Hullbreacher. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on using various self-mill cards like Careful Study, Stitcher's Supplier, and Hedron Crab to fill up the graveyard. The goal is to quickly get Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis onto the battlefield alongside Vengevine and Bloodghast. This allows for explosive plays and combos with cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below. Cabal Therapy is used to disrupt opponents' strategies while Gravecrawler provides recurring value. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Spirit of the Labyrinth while also deploying aggressive threats like Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition. It also aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Phyrexian Revoker. The deck utilizes Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and gain incremental advantages over the opponent. The equipment package with Stoneforge Mystic adds another layer of versatility and resilience to the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. By utilizing efficient creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Skyclave Apparition, alongside powerful disruptive spells like Swords to Plowshares and Wasteland, the deck aims to control the board while developing its own threats. The Green Sun's Zenith toolbox allows for versatile answers to various situations, while cards like Sylvan Library and Once Upon a Time provide card advantage and consistency. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a mix of green and white creatures, with access to powerful lands like Karakas and Cavern of Souls.

The main concept of this deck is to have a mix of aggressive and midrange elements in order to control the board and disrupt the opponent while applying pressure. The deck uses a variety of powerful and versatile cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns, Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, and Force of Will to maintain control. It also includes cards such as Valki, God of Lies and Shardless Agent to generate card advantage. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to handle threats. The mana base includes various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

This deck utilizes a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. It focuses on generating value through cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, while also utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay to control the board. The mana base is built around Arcum's Astrolabe to fix colors and enable the powerful snow synergies. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of threats and disruption, creating a versatile and adaptable game plan.

This Combo - Show and Tell deck aims to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand onto the battlefield through cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack, gaining a huge advantage over the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Cunning Wish to set up the combo pieces and find answers against disruption. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and Daze, along with ramp from Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence through efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, while also utilizing powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will to control the pace of the game. The key strategy is to apply pressure early on with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, all while maintaining card advantage and tempo. The mana base is designed to support a consistent and fast start, ensuring that the deck can consistently deploy threats and disrupt opponent's game plan.

The main concept of the deck is to generate a massive amount of mana and quickly flood the board with Elves in order to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo finish. The deck utilizes cards like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel to generate mana, while cards like Glimpse of Nature and Wirewood Symbiote help draw through the deck to find key pieces like Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order to finish the game. The goal is to create a strong board presence and combo off for a lethal attack in just a few turns.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base by playing disruptive red cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Trinisphere. This allows the deck to take advantage of powerful aggro creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss to quickly close out the game. The deck also leverages mana acceleration from cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to deploy threats ahead of schedule. Overall, the strategy revolves around punishing opponents for playing non-basic lands and overwhelming them with aggressive creatures.
